body.p: Harper enlisted in the 30th Tennessee Infantry and was captured at the Battle of Fort Donelson on February 16, 1862. He escaped at an undetermined date and joined with General John Hunt Morgan, who procured a Captain’s commision for Harper. Harper’s Partisan Rangers were active along the Louisville & Nashville rail line in Confederate territory under occupation by Union forces. Harper and his men surrendered and were paroled on May 9, 1865.
